snippet: The Louisiana-Pacific Corporation said yesterday that it had agreed to sell 38,000 acres of timberland in Northern California to the privately held Sierra-Pacific Industries for $50 million. Louisiana-Pacific, a building products company based in ...
lead_paragraph: The Louisiana-Pacific Corporation said yesterday that it had agreed to sell 38,000 acres of timberland in Northern California to the privately held Sierra-Pacific Industries for $50 million. Louisiana-Pacific, a building products company based in Portland, Ore., said the timberland, known as the Feather Falls tract, is in the northeast part of the Sacramento Valley. Louisiana-Pacific said the tract is too far from the company's remaining California sawmills, which are along the coast. Sierra-Pacific, based in Redding, Calif., is California's largest timberland owner.
abstract: Louisiana-Pacific Corp agrees to sell 38,000 acres of timberland in Northern California to privately held Sierra-Pacific Industries for $50 million; timberland is in northeast part of Sacramento Valley (S)

headline.main: LOUISIANA-PACIFIC TO GET $50 MILLION FOR TIMBER TRACT
